title: Clitopho by Plato
description: Clitopho is the Latin title the short dialogue which is also known as Clitophon or Cleitophon (ΚΛΕΙΤΟΦΩΝ). Plato may or may not have been the author. Clitopho complains that Socrates is good at exhorting people to justice but not able to make them just. Translated by George Burges. Painting: After the Bath by Edgar Degas.
content:encoded: Clitopho is the Latin title the short dialogue which is also known as Clitophon or Cleitophon (ΚΛΕΙΤΟΦΩΝ). Plato may or may not have been the author. Clitopho complains that Socrates is good at exhorting people to justice but not able to make them just. Translated by George Burges. Painting: After the Bath by Edgar Degas.
itunes:subtitle: Cleitophon (Greek: ΚΛΕΙΤΟΦΩΝ Latin: Clitopho) may or may not have been written by Plato. Clitopho complains that Socrates is good at exhorting people to justice but not able to make them just.
